title: Read cotizador-api structure from devmaster production
description: SSH to devmaster and read /opt/clients/af/services/cotizador-api/ structure. Document all endpoints, routes, routers (audio, video, document branches), and Caddyfile configuration. This is READ-ONLY for reference.

title: Read contact sheet scripts from devmaster vision-testing
description: SSH to devmaster and read /opt/clients/af/dev/scripts/vision-testing/generate_contact_sheets.sh and related scripts. Document the pipeline: Frames-Img → ImageContactSheets-Img. This is READ-ONLY for reference.

title: Create PRD for media-analysis service cloning
description: Create PRD document describing how to clone AF's cotizador-api to new service at /opt/services/media-analysis/. Include: endpoint renaming strategy (e.g., /api/media/... vs /api/analyze), new service name, port allocation, Caddyfile configuration, database isolation, and conflict prevention. Surgical changes only - no IP conflicts, no route conflicts.

title: Clone cotizador-api to /opt/services/media-analysis/ on devmaster
description: SSH to devmaster, copy /opt/clients/af/services/cotizador-api/ to /opt/services/media-analysis/. This is the surgical clone - same infrastructure patterns, different naming, no conflicts. Keep original structure but rename service-specific elements.

title: Rename endpoints and routes in cloned service
description: In /opt/services/media-analysis/, rename all endpoints from /api/analyze/* to /api/media/* (or similar). Update Caddyfile routes, any internal references, and service name constants. Ensure zero conflict with production cotizador-api.

title: Add media-analysis aggregator endpoint with prompt support
description: Create new endpoint POST /api/media/analyze that accepts: video_path (string), prompt (natural language), and optional parameters. This aggregator orchestrates: frame extraction → contact sheet → LLM analysis. Pass natural language prompt through to LLM for nuanced analysis (hair movement, motion blur, clothing dynamics, lighting, facial expression).

title: Add video branch with frame extraction and contact sheet
description: In media-analysis service, create/update video branch with: POST /api/media/video/extract-frames (extract frames at 3fps using FFmpeg), POST /api/media/video/contact-sheet (generate grid from frames). Integrate the contact sheet script from vision-testing (2x3 grid format for LLM parsing).

title: Add audio branch with YouTube transcription (Deepgram/Grok)
description: In media-analysis service, create audio branch with: POST /api/media/audio/transcribe-youtube (accepts YouTube URL, downloads audio, sends to Deepgram/Grok for transcription). Store transcript with timestamps. This route is separate from video analysis but can be combined via aggregator.

title: Add document branch for image/document analysis
description: In media-analysis service, create document branch with: POST /api/media/document/analyze (accepts image/document, returns analysis). Reuse existing analysis patterns from cotizador-api but adapted for media content.

title: Document XTTS API usage in CLAUDE.md
close_reason: XTTS API documented in CLAUDE.md with endpoints, examples, and VO script usage

title: Integrate Minimax API for LLM analysis
description: Create Minimax API integration in media-analysis service. Add: minimax_client.py with vision capabilities, config for API key (eventually via OpenRouter for simplicity), endpoint to send contact sheet + transcript + prompt to Minimax. Support both vision (image) and text prompts.

title: Create Caddyfile configuration for media-analysis service
description: Create Caddyfile route for /opt/services/media-analysis/ service. Allocate new subdomain or route (e.g., media.af.automatic.picturelle.com or /api/media/*). Ensure no conflict with existing cotizador-api routes. Test routing before deployment.

title: Deploy and test media-analysis service on devmaster
description: Deploy cloned service to devmaster: docker compose build, docker compose up -d. Test endpoints with curl. Verify no conflicts with production cotizador-api. Document test results.

title: Research Minimax API key via OpenRouter
description: Create /web research command to check if Minimax API is available through OpenRouter. If so, add Minimax to OpenRouter config for simplified API key management. Create beat to remind to update OpenRouter with Minimax API key next week.

title: Add beat reminder for OpenRouter Minimax API key
description: Create recurring beat/reminder to update OpenRouter configuration with Minimax API key. This is scheduled for next week after Minimax research is complete.

title: Add QWEN3_VL and GPT5_MINI providers to capability_matrix.py
description: Add QWEN3_VL and GPT5_MINI provider enums and capabilities to /opt/services/media-analysis/api/capability_matrix.py. QWEN3_VL: model='qwen/qwen3-vl-30b-a3b-instruct', providers=['novita', 'phala', 'fireworks']. GPT5_MINI: model='openai/gpt-5-mini', provider='openrouter'. Include cost_per_1k_input, cost_per_1k_output, avg_latency_ms, accuracy_score, supported task types (vision, document).

title: Create Whisper adapter for OpenAI transcription fallback
description: Create /opt/services/media-analysis/api/adapters/whisper.py with OpenAI Whisper API integration. Use OpenAI API key from .env. Simple adapter pattern matching other providers.

title: Update _init_fallback_chains with corrected provider configuration
description:
Update /opt/services/media-analysis/api/prompt_router.py _init_fallback_chains() with CORRECTED chains:

AUDIO TRANSCRIPTION (Groq primary):
- Groq (whisper-large-v3) → Deepgram (nova-2) → Whisper-1 (OpenAI) → Gemini 3.5 Flash (OpenRouter)

VISION/DOCUMENT ANALYSIS (Qwen3 primary):
- Qwen3-VL 30B A3B (novita → phala → fireworks) → Gemini 2.5 Flash (google-vertex → google-ai-studio, OpenRouter) → GPT-5 Mini (openai/gpt-5-mini, OpenRouter) → MiniMax (direct API)

TEXT GENERATION:
- MiniMax (direct API) → Gemini 2.5 Flash (google-vertex → google-ai-studio, OpenRouter) → Haiku (OpenRouter)

REASONING/ANALYSIS:
- MiniMax (direct API) → Gemini 2.5 Flash (google-vertex → google-ai-studio, OpenRouter) → Haiku (OpenRouter)

CRITICAL: Vision chain ends with MiniMax fallback (not starts with it).

title: Update config/.env with OpenAI API key
description: Add OPENAI_API_KEY to /opt/services/media-analysis/config/.env for Whisper adapter. Use placeholder if key not yet available.

title: Test updated fallback chains
description: Test all updated fallback chains (Transcription, Vision, Document, Reasoning, Text). Verify each chain with curl requests. Document results in test report.

title: Switch to daswer123/xtts-api-server for API+UI
close_reason: Updated docker-compose to use daswer123/xtts-api-server with full API

title: Deploy media-analysis API changes to devmaster
description: Deploy updated media-analysis-api to devmaster. SSH, docker compose build, docker compose up -d. Test new endpoints: /api/prompt/route with various task types. Verify health check returns all providers healthy.

title: RunPod Local Testing & Audit Epic
description:
## Problem
Spent significant budget on RunPod without verifying downloads work. Models not appearing, no visibility into download progress.

## Goals
1. Emulate RunPod environment locally (Docker)
2. Verify download_models.sh works correctly
3. Add proper logging/progress visibility
4. Test workflows locally before deploying
5. Create reliable deployment checklist

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Local Docker runs same image as RunPod
- [ ] download_models.sh downloads all models correctly
- [ ] Logs show clear progress (not silent failures)
- [ ] WAN 2.2 + TurboDiffusion workflow tested locally
- [ ] Zero-cost validation before any RunPod spend

title: Test XTTS API endpoints locally
close_reason: XTTS API endpoints verified: /tts_to_file and /tts_to_audio both working

- Tests TurboDiffusion I2V

title: VibeVoice needs Qwen tokenizer download
description:
VibeVoice-Large requires Qwen2.5 tokenizer files.

Download from: https://huggingface.co/Qwen/Qwen2.5-1.5B/tree/main
Required files: tokenizer_config.json, vocab.json, merges.txt, tokenizer.json
Place in: /workspace/ComfyUI/models/vibevoice/tokenizer/

Add to download_models.sh in VibeVoice section.
close_reason: Fixed: Added Qwen tokenizer download to download_models.sh and corrected VibeVoice repo URL (AIFSH -> aoi-ot)

title: [PRD] Deploy to RunPod A100 with R2 sync

description: Install mmcv==2.1.0, mmpose, flash_attn==2.7.4.post1. Update PyTorch to 2.5.1 for compatibility.

title: Enhance download script for DWPose + SteadyDancer fp16
description: Add DWPose weights download (yzd-v/DWPose). Configure SteadyDancer fp16 download (MCG-NJU/SteadyDancer-14B, ~28GB).

title: Configure DWPose extraction for driving video pose
description: Set up DWPose preprocessor nodes. Create pose extraction workflow for driving video. Configure 1024x576 resolution, 25-30 FPS.

title: Create SteadyDancer fp16 dance workflow with camera movement
description: Create workflow: Reference Image + Driving Video + DWPose → SteadyDancer I2V. Include prompt engineering for dance (hair, fabric, earrings). Add camera movement prompts (pan, zoom, orbit).

title: Local Docker test with SteadyDancer fp16
description: Test Dockerfile builds. Verify model downloads. Run SteadyDancer workflow with cosplayer reference image. Monitor VRAM (~53GB expected). Test prompt variations.

title: Deploy SteadyDancer fp16 + TurboDiffusion to RunPod A100 80GB Secure Cloud
description: Deploy hearmeman-extended with SteadyDancer fp16 and TurboDiffusion to RunPod Secure Cloud A100 80GB. Configure: ENABLE_STEADYDANCER=true, STEADYDANCER_VARIANT=fp16, ENABLE_WAN22_DISTILL=true, GPU_MEMORY_MODE=auto. Disable all voice models to save VRAM. Configure R2 sync for output persistence. Test end-to-end workflow with cosplayer reference video.

title: Phase 1: Dockerfile SteadyDancer dependencies
description: Update docker/Dockerfile lines 61-75, 148-177 with PyTorch 2.5.1, mmcv 2.1.0, mmpose, flash_attn 2.7.4.post1, xformers 0.0.29.post1. Create steadydancer model directory. Verify build succeeds.

title: Oscar's voice cloning test
description: Test voice cloning with Oscar's own voice sample for Spanish TTS. Requirements: 10+ seconds clean audio, 24kHz sample rate, single speaker, minimal background noise. Test with Chatterbox Multilingual model for Spanish output.

title: ma-22: Create Database Models and Connection Layer
Fix automatic model downloads at pod startup
description:
## Problem
Models are not downloading automatically when RunPod pod starts, despite:
- download_models.sh being called from start.sh (line 139)
- Environment variables being set correctly

## Root Causes Identified
1. **WAN models**: hf_download() uses wget but no logging on failure
2. **VibeVoice/XTTS**: Uses Python snapshot_download which fails silently if huggingface_hub has issues
3. **No download progress visible** in logs

## Files to Fix
- docker/start.sh - add better logging before/after download_models.sh
- docker/download_models.sh - add explicit error handling and logging

## Fix Strategy
1. Add set -x for debugging in download_models.sh
2. Log output to /var/log/download_models.log
3. Add explicit error checking after each download
4. Test with fresh pod deployment
close_reason: Fixed download_models.sh: added logging to /var/log/download_models.log, created hf_snapshot_download() helper with error handling, added download summary at end

title: Add download progress logging
description:
Improvements needed:
- Show file sizes during download
- Show download speed
- Log to both stdout and file
- Show percentage complete for large files
close_reason: Added file sizes, DRY_RUN mode, timeout
